Lack enough support: The claim that AAP MLA Amanatullah Khan was part of a mob that burned buses lacks sufficient evidence or proof.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that because Khan was present at the protest, he must have been involved in the burning of buses, which is a problematic assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation provided by Khan himself and a local attendee of the protest, stating that he was conducting a peaceful agitation at a different location during the time of the bus burning.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that there are no reports of buses being torched in the area where Khan was present.
Understate: There is no evidence to suggest that the claim understates any information.
Exaggerate: There is no evidence to suggest that the claim exaggerates any information.
Falters at times: There is no evidence to suggest that the claim falters at times.
